bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. WESTERN DIVISION OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of Applicatioon of K. GREGORY, et al. for a WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, That I. Emelin, as principal, and Samuel H. Weber, residing at 1509 East Spruce Street in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, and B. Helfand, residing at 1112 Broadway Court, in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto the United States of America in the full sum of two Hundred and Fifty Dollars ($250.00), to be paid to the United States, for which payment well and truly made, we, and each of us, do bind ourselves, our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents.
Sealed with our Seals this 27 day of February, A.D. 1914.
WHEREAS, I. EMELIN, and alien, a native of Russia, who arrived at the Port of Seattle, Washington on the day of , 1913, has been held by the Immigration Board for deportation, and
WHEREAS, the Immigration Board ordered the said alien to be deported, and
WHEREAS, the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, discharg-
